Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Crinicepsin-2  (natural AMPs; insects, arthropods, invertebrates, animals, XXA; UCLL1c)

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that the sequence of this peptide shows 38% similarity tohuman Histatin 4.Activity: Moderately active against S. aureus MTCC 3160 or MTCC 9542 (MIC 40 uM), and weakly active against E. coli (MIC 81 uM), P.aeruginosa MTCC 8076 (MIC 162 uM) and V. cholerae (MIC 81 uM). 125 ug/ml converted to 81 uM. Updated 7/2021
Literature Information.Author: Bhagavathula N, Meedidoddi V, Bourque S, Vimaladevi R, Kesavakurup S, Selvadurai D, Shrivastava S, Krishnappa C. 2017
Literature Information.Reference: Arch Insect Biochem Physiol. 2017 Apr;94(4).  doi: 10.1002/arch.21381.PubMed
Literature Information.Title: Characterization of two novel antimicrobial peptides from the cuticular extracts of the ant Trichomyrmex criniceps (Mayr), (Hymenoptera: Formicidae).
